intro: Andromeda phillyreifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, while its flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in late winter to early spring. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in challenging garden conditions.
